name: Kadhi
history: Kadhi is a beloved dish in Indian cuisine, varying in style across regions. It's known for its creamy texture and tangy taste, made primarily from yogurt and gram flour.
description: Kadhi is a yogurt-based curry, thickened with gram flour and seasoned with spices. Often accompanied by pakoras (fried fritters), it's a comfort food served with rice or roti.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: For blending the yogurt and flour.

instructions.title: Prepare the Yogurt Mixture
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the yogurt, gram flour, turmeric powder, and water until smooth.

instructions.title: Cook the Kadhi
instructions.description: In a pan, heat some oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, curry leaves, slit green chilies, and grated ginger. Once they start spluttering, pour in the yogurt mixture. Bring to a boil and then simmer on low heat for about 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

instructions.title: Finalize and Serve
instructions.description: Once the kadhi has thickened and has a creamy consistency, season with salt. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with rice or as a soup.

tips: Consistently stir the kadhi while cooking to avoid curdling.
Adjust the consistency of the kadhi by adding water if it becomes too thick.
variations: Add pakoras (fried gram flour fritters) to the kadhi for a more filling dish.
Experiment with different spices like fenugreek seeds or dried red chilies for variation.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat gently on the stove or in a microwave, stirring frequently.
presentationTips: Serve in a deep bowl, garnished with coriander leaves, accompanied by rice or warm flatbread.
